new forest homes without water due to burst water main .

documents.title: ceremony for british fighters killed in syria
text: a military ceremony has been held to honour two british volunteer fighters who were killed in syria .
oliver hall , 24 , from the portsmouth area , and jac holmes , also 24 , from bournemouth , both died while clearing mines in raqqa , it has been reported .
the ypg kurdish militia formed an honour guard as their coffins were brought from syria into iraq .

documents.title: community helps clear snow from school
text: volunteers have been helping clear away from snow in hailey , oxfordshire .
its primary school is one of about 180 schools which have been closed due to snow in the county today .
hanborough and minster lovell councillor , liam walker , says parents and pupils have been getting involved
more community spirit in action !
now in hailey helping staff , parents and children clear access routes to the village primary school .
the parents seem to be more keen than the kids ! !
haha # uksnow

documents.title: a snowy scene at oxford castle
text: this aerial shot of oxford castle in the snow was captured by drone pilot jared reabow yesterday .

documents.title: appeal after poppy donation box theft
text: cctv images of a man police want to speak to after a charity donation box was stolen in oxfordshire have been released .
the box was taken from an esso petrol station on station road , wallingford , on 8 november at about 23:25 ( gmt ) .
a man entered with a white women , who was in her twenties , and took the charity poppy box , said thames valley police .
pc julie nutland said the man in the images may have `` vital '' information .
author: Marcus Liddell
BBC South

documents.title: jury retires in alleged gang shooting case
text: a judge said the case of a man accused of murdering a gang leader with a machine gun is `` one of identification '' .
terrance 'jeff ' allamby was killed on the orts road estate in reading in september 1996 , after a fight broke out involving a drug-dealing gang .
but howard patterson , 52 , denies murder and claims he was with friends in london when the incident happened .
a jury of four men and eight women retired on monday to consider the evidence put before them at reading crown court .
judge joanna cutts qc told jurors there was `` no dispute '' that `` someone murdered '' terrance 'jeff ' allamby in reading in september 1996 .
but judge cutts added the `` issue '' for the jury to `` resolve '' was whether they were sure it was `` this defendant .

documents.title: how hopeful are people of getting a good brexit deal ?
text: how hopeful are people of getting a good brexit deal ?

documents.title: ice weather warning remains in place
text: the met office has issued a yellow 'be aware ' weather warning for ice .
ice is expected to form on some surfaces from late afternoon and last overnight into tuesday morning .
temperatures are expected to drop to -10°c ( 14°f ) in oxfordshire and berkshire .
hampshire will see temperatures drop to -7°c ( 19°f ) and -4°c ( 25°f ) is expected in dorset .
yellow warning of ice for south west england

documents.title: appeal to trace murder trial juries
text: a bbc documentary team examining the murder of a student has appealed to speak to members of the juries which tried a man for her murder .
language student oki shin , 26 , was stabbed to death as she walked home from a nightclub in bournemouth in july 2002 .
omar benguit was convicted in 2005 of murdering her after being put on trial three times .
benguit , from bournemouth , has lost two appeals against his conviction .
`` for legal reasons we can only talk to jurors about their individual impressions of the evidence presented in court .
we ca n't discuss any statements made , opinions expressed , arguments advanced , or votes cast by themselves or anyone else during the jury 's deliberations . ''

documents.title: breakingman admits starting hospital and museum fires
text: a man 's admitted starting fires at a hospital , university and museum earlier this year .
the blazes happened in june at the royal stoke university hospital , a staffordshire university accommodation building and the seacity museum in southampton .
patients had to be evacuated , many on their beds .

today at stafford crown court , thomas ashcroft , 39 , of musgrave crescent , sheffield pleaded guilty to three charges of arson being reckless as to whether life would be endangered relating to all three fires and a charge of burglary at the museum .

a charge of manslaughter was withdrawn by the prosecution due to insufficient evidence and two not guilty pleas on charges of arson with intent to endanger life were accepted by the cps and wo n't go to trial .
it followed the death of an 89-year-old woman in hospital .
ashcroft will be sentenced in february .
author: Jennie Aitken
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: 'misgendering ' teacher to sue school
text: 'misgendering ' teacher to sue school

documents.title: how cold is it where you are ?
text: how cold is it where you are ?

documents.title: boat 'arson ' outside southsea home
text: police are investigating after a boat fire outside a home in southsea in a suspected arson attack .
the 19ft ( 6m ) fishing boat was inside a trailer next to the owner 's house on cleveland road when it was set on fire - with the flames causing considerable damage to the side of the house .
officers said no-one was injured during the blaze which happened on friday night .
they 're looking for three hooded men who were seen in the area shortly before the fire started .

documents.title: 'do not travel on our services '
text: thinking of travelling in or out of london waterloo on lines from portsmouth , reading , basingstoke and weymouth ?
well do n't , apparently .
south western railway is advising people not to travel on its services because of a fire in the waterloo area .
services are expected to be disrupted until 20:00 gmt this evening .

documents.title: work to repair new forest burst water main continues
text: southern water says the repairs in ashurst are complex and it may take some time to fix .
about 70 properties are without water in the new forest village after a water main burst in lyndhurst road at 04:00 this morning .
bottled water is being given to residents at the car wash at the junction of ash road and lyndhurst road .

documents.title: blenheim palace in the snow
text: blenheim palace in the snow

documents.title: still no power for 400 oxfordshire properties
text: about 400 properties in oxfordshire remain without power after snow storms and strong winds hit the county yesterday .
north leach , burford , faringdon and kidlington are the areas affected .
scottish and southern electricity networks says the power should be back on by mid-afternoon

documents.title: university criticised for ' # snowday '
text: oxford brookes university , which closed all its buildings due to `` heavy snow '' , has been criticised on social media by students .
it used the hashtag # snowday to accompany a tweet that said it would be shut on sunday and monday .
in response one student said : `` i do n't think # snowday is an appropriate hashtag we deserve to know why we have no access to our library . ''
defending the closure , the university said icy conditions were expected to cause difficulties as more snow fell .

documents.title: teen charged over southampton bank robbery
text: a teenager has been charged in connection with an attempted robbery at a bank in shirley high street , southampton .
the offence took place at the santander branch on 5 december at about 13:45 gmt .
the 19-year-old has been charged with attempted robbery and possession of a bladed article in a public place .
he will appear before southampton magistrates later .

documents.title: condor ferry poole-channel islands service cancelled
text: adverse weather conditions have led to delays and the cancellation of condor rapide 's scheduled service at 15:50 gmt from guernsey to poole this afternoon .
condor said wind speeds and wave heights were `` beyond our safe operational limits for high speed operation cross channel '' .
the firm said tuesday 's service from poole at 05:00 is also now cancelled .
info | rapide service delayed due weather.please visit for more info

documents.title: chris rea 's bournemouth concert cancelled
text: chris rea has cancelled a concert due at the bournemouth international centre tomorrow .
the singer is said to be in a stable condition in hospital after collapsing during a performance at the new theatre oxford .

please see the below statement from the event promoter regarding chris rea - unfortunately , chris rea is unable to perform at the bournemouth international centre ( bic ) on tuesday 12th december due to illness .
all ticket holders should obtain refunds at point of purchase .
absolutely gutted but wishing @ twitterid a speedy recovery xx

documents.title: breakinglondon waterloo disruption after lineside fire
text: due to a lineside fire in the waterloo area train services are subject to delay , alteration or cancellation .
do not travel advice has been issued by south western railway as numerous services have been cancelled or severely delayed .

documents.title: chris rea cancels bournemouth show
text: singer chris rea has cancelled a planned show at the bournemouth international centre ( bic ) tomorrow night due to illness .
it comes after the artist , who is known for his hits `` driving home for christmas '' and `` road to hell '' , collapsed during a performance in oxford on saturday night .
he was said to be in a stable condition in hospital .
the bic has told all ticket holders to get refunds from their point of purchase .

documents.title: aerial shot of snow-hit oxford
text: the national police air service ( npas ) helicopter based at benson has captured this snowy scene over oxford this morning .
another aerial image from oxford today .

text: people due to see singer chris rea in bournemouth tomorrow are anxiously waiting for news .
he collapsed mid-song at a performance at the new theatre oxford on saturday night and was taken to hospital where he 's said to be stable .
his concert last night in brighton was cancelled .
a decision has not yet been made on the concert due at the bournemouth international centre .

documents.title: cow lane bridge one-way from today
text: traffic under cow lane bridge in reading will be northbound only from today .
the council says it is to reduce delays which it say would `` worsen significantly '' during works by network rail .
the works are the final phase of road widening work , which included the demolition of the old cow lane bridge in november .
the temporary one-way restriction for vehicles will remain in place until july 2018

documents.title: your snowy
text: here 's a few of yesterday 's snowfall in oxfordshire .

documents.title: crash closes road in dorset
text: drivers are being warned of long delays following a crash in christchurch which has closed hurn road .
update : christchurch - major disruption due to a collision on b3073 hurn road .
it has certainly made hillside drive busy .

documents.title: motorists warned of delays as water main bursts
text: drivers are being warned to allow extra time through ashurst in the new forest this morning .
two-way temporary traffic lights are in place following a burst water main on lyndhurst road .
# a35 # ashurst - temp signals in operation on a35 lyndhurst rd near the happy cheese pub due to a burst water main .
expect delays .

documents.title: cotswold wildlife park closed
text: cotswold wildlife park is closed today due to the `` extreme weather conditions '' - so it 's a day off for the animals although the flamingos do n't look like they 're enjoying much !

documents.title: hundreds of oxforshire homes remain without power
text: engineers are still working to restore power to homes after the heavy snowfall .
scottish and southern electricity networks ( ssen ) said around 800 customers remain off supply in oxfordshire and parts of wiltshire .
faults are affecting north leach , burford , grove , faringdon and kidlington in oxfordshire and hannington , wiltshire .
ssen said all homes are expected to be reconnected by lunchtime today .
welfare vans , serving free hot food and drinks , are in the following locations :
i would like to apologise to anyone who was without power overnight and assure them we will be working hard to carry out the final repairs this morning .

documents.title: snow and ice shelves bin collections
text: west oxfordshire district council has said a limited bin collection service will run due to the wintry weather .
residents are advised to leave their bins out for collection .
it said any outstanding collections will be completed by wednesday but this is dependent on the weather conditions .
we will be trying our utmost to reach as many areas as possible but the roads are very icy and dangerous .
collections have been suspended for the safety of our residents , their property and bin crews .

documents.title: snow and ice disrupting heathrow flights
text: heathrow is continuing to experience severe adverse weather conditions .
some flights have been cancelled and others are being diverted to alternative airports including bournemouth .
some flights at heathrow will be disrupted today due to crew and aircraft being out of position following yesterday 's weather .
as always , our advice to passengers is to check your flight status with your airline before coming to the airport : ( 1/3 )
if your flight is cancelled , we ask that you do not travel to the airport and keep updated via your airline 's website .
we 're working with our airline partners to return aircraft to where they need to be and full service recovery remains the focus .
the safety and comfort of our passengers is always our first priority and we 're working closely with our airlines to ensure affected passengers are looked after .
we apologise to those whose travel has been impacted and regret the inconveniences that has been caused .

documents.title: at least 183 schools in oxfordshire closed
text: the snow has had a big impact on schools in oxfordshire .
reports of closures are coming in all the time but so far 183 have told bbc radio oxford they 're not opening today .
at least 182 schools in oxfordshire are closed due to snow today , these are all the ones which have told bbc radio oxford they are not open

documents.title: power disruption continues in oxfordshire
text: electricity supplier sse says engineers are working to restore power to about 800 homes in oxfordshire after snow and wind saw tree branches coming into contact with overhead cables on sunday .
the company is serving free hot food and drinks to affected residents .
homes in north leach , burford , grove , faringdon and kidlington are the worst affected .
vans , serving free hot food and drinks have been set up in the following locations :

documents.title: snow day for students in oxford
text: oxford brookes has closed all its buildings today due to the snow which fell over oxfordshire yesterday .
the university said students would be sent details by email about re-scheduling missed or cancelled exams and relevant mitigating circumstances .

documents.title: troubled cowes 'floating bridge ' ferry back in service
text: a chain ferry which was withdrawn after numerous technical failures and damage to vehicles is back in service .
the troubled cowes floating bridge was suspended on 4 september , four months after the £ 3.2m vessel began operating .
a replacement has been operating for foot passengers , while vehicles have had to take a 12-mile ( 19km ) detour .
isle of wight council said the service would restart as part of an extended trial but warned it may be stopped or reduced at certain times .
she 's back !
floating bridge 6 is back in service between cowes and east cowes for an extended trial period '' .
# floaty # isleofwight
although east cowes has been removed from the route i just head out to the middle of the medina and then back to west cowes
dukes of hazard ramp to be installed , less damage to cars expected
welcome to real life gta !

documents.title: oxford university hospitals appointments 'unaffected ' despite snow
text: outpatient and day surgery appointments will run as normal at oxford university hospitals despite heavy snowfall .
oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust said patient transport would be available but only for renal and chemotherapy appointments .
it has asked patients to check travel conditions before setting off .

documents.title: burst water main affects new forest homes
text: about 70 homes in ashhurst , on the edge of new forest , have lost their water supply this morning because of a burst main .
the trunk main has burst on lyndhurst road .
southern water said there are gas mains nearby so it 's waiting for engineers to arrive .
bottled water is being sent to the area .
our team 's working to resolve issues in lyndhurst road , ashurst , so407ar .
we 'll provide updates asap .
more info :
are you working in the road please ?
are there any restrictions for traffic ?
thanks .

documents.title: snowfall leads to school closures
text: disruption after the weekend 's snowfall continues in oxfordshire and berkshire with many schools closed this morning .
about 90 schools are closed across oxfordshire and several , including hermitage primary school in thatcham and lambourn church of england primary school are also closed in berkshire .
the henley college will be closed on monday 11th december due to adverse weather conditions .
stay safe # closure # snow # weather # safety
will college be open tuesday the 12th dec ?
hi we will be open as normal tomorrow

documents.title: ice warning in place
text: motorists are being warned of `` treacherous '' road conditions as snow turns into ice this morning with the met office issuing a yellow weather warning of ice .
some roads and railways are likely to be affected with longer and more difficult journeys .
there is also the risk of up to 5cm of additional snow on higher ground in hampshire , but it is not expected to settle at lower levels .
yellow warning of ice for south west england

documents.title: latest headlines : 'treacherous ' ice warning in place
text: latest headlines : 'treacherous ' ice warning in place

documents.title: monday 's weather : outbreaks of rain , sleet or snow
text: generally cloudy with a mixture of rain , sleet and snow , along with strong winds , perhaps reaching gale force along the coast and over the solent .
becoming drier from the west this afternoon , with clear periods developing .
maximum temperature : 4 deg c ( 39 deg f )

documents.title: snow causes power and travel disruption
text: scottish and southern electric says almost 800 homes in oxfordshire have spent the night without power following yesterday 's heavy snow and winds .
customers in north leach , burford , grove , faringdon and kidlington are the worst affected , as engineers were unable to gain access to the site of the faults .
the company has offered welfare vans nearby serving hot food and drinks .
scores of schools and colleges have also been forced to close .
yesterday , 15,000 homes were affected during the severe weather with stretches of the m40 , a34 , a40 and a420 also shut and buses at one point suspended .
chiltern railways has warned services may continue to be affected today .

documents.title: good morning : )
text: good morning and welcome to bbc south live .
we will be bringing you all of the region 's latest news , travel , sport and weather until 18:00 .
stay in touch via ourhampshire , dorset , berkshireandoxfordfacebook pages or by using twitter @ bbc hampshire , @ bbcdorset , @ bbcberkshireand @ bbcoxford .
